website_summaries.verdict: These 2 locks come with inspection indicators to let you know your bags have been inspected.
pros: Locks can take the rough handling of checked air travel well
Combination doesn't take long to set
Locks come in several colors to make your bags easier to spot at baggage claim
Large numbers on the locks are easy to see
cons: Some reports of getting a lock that doesn't operate properly

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these locks!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for wife's trip to Argentina. Tested and set up before using on luggage. When she reached her destination two of the locks would not open. She had to find an English speaking person to cut the two locks off and then had to purchase new replacement locks for the luggage. She arrived back home and presented me with the bad locks. Do not buy this brand of locks!
customer_reviews.author: Senior Master Sergeant Sean O'Casey, USAF (Retired)

customer_reviews.title: Too Hard to Close
customer_reviews.text: These locks are very nice, EXCEPT for one thing. They are quite difficult to close. (all four) One has to push the cable end down into the opening far enough to "click" it into place. This takes a lot of force, and requires a firm pinch of the cable to apply the requisite pressure. If your fingers are the least bit wet or slippery, forget it. I am a grown man with strong hands and have to use my dominant hand to lock these locks. I can barely do it with my weaker hand. I expect my wife will be unable to lock them at all.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Still working after a drop kick by TSA
customer_reviews.text: I travel with pelican cases for road shows and wanted a TSA lock for them. They have been shipped 20 times in one month and they work as expected. During one of my travels, TSA must have dropped kicked the box and landed on the lock smashing the printed numbers off one of the cylinders. Did this lock stop working? no, it was abused but kept on like the energizer bunny. For that, I would buy them again knowing they can take abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Luggage locks that hold their own...
customer_reviews.text: These locks did their job and were especially well suited for me, since my close up vision isn't what it used to be. The numbers are big enough that I don't have to run around looking for my readers just to open my suitcase. The instructions for setting your own code are simple to follow, and the locks' actual construction seems substantial enough. They certainly held their own (no pun intended) during our recent trip to Peru. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B. News

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad little lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought a single lock for my trip to Europe and I loved that I had it. I plan on buying more because it was nice to have a deterrent. I understand it's not going to be 100% what I would love...but I very rarely ever check a suitcase and it's nice to have an obstacle, should someone get curious. I personally use the bottom of my zippers to loop it through that way it's a little harder to get to, should someone try to reach for it. Also, it's easy to reprogram and was a little piece of mind when my bag was in my hotel room.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect locks for bags and luggage.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to lock my range bag. They fit in the zippers well and are a great size for this purpose. Easy to reset your lock code without the use of any tools. Tumblers work well and are very easy to rotate and read. The push button release works as intended to unlock and lock. Also has a red indicator that pops if your lock is opened by the TSA. Due to the locks having the TSA key lock this should prevent your locks from being cut during inspections. Received 4 for $19 bucks so $5 each, I feel this to be a good and fair price given the metal construction, quality and overall flawless workings
customer_reviews.author: Mr Frosty

customer_reviews.title: The programming lever was stiff enough that I found it better to use a pen to flip it rather than ...
customer_reviews.text: The order came quickly and they worked perfectly. I wanted a distinctive color to help find my checked luggage and these did the job. The cable provides enough extra length to allow securing multiple zippered sections with a single lock. The side-view numbers make it much easier to see that you have put in the correct code. I wanted an indication that the TSA had looked into my bag and this lock provides it. The programming lever was stiff enough that I found it better to use a pen to flip it rather than my thumbnail.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Buyer-be-ware - If I had to do it again, I would not purchase these locks.
customer_reviews.text: The locks work simply enough, but one of the four locks did not open after the combination was changed. I would highly recommend that go you with another manufacturer. The flexiable cable is very thin and it looks like it can be very easily cut off. I have some Master locks that are not the flex type, and they are much better built. Next time I will go with a proven name like Master lock.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Bernard

customer_reviews.title: That Secure Feeling
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to set my own combination on these locks. I used them on the last trip to Canada and one indicated that it had been opened by TSA. Inside that bag was a form letter indicating that TSA had inspected the bag. I really like them because other people can't easily get into my fabric bags when they are locked - but they can be inspected by proper personnel with their key.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: The locks are nice enough, but in the very first trip I took with them the TSA inspectors just cut them off. One they appearantly threw away, the other was thrown, cable cut, in on top of my clothes in the suitcase. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: NickB

customer_reviews.title: TSA does not need to relock to get their key out.
customer_reviews.text: TSA opened two of my bags and was able to remove their keys without relocking. See the pic, locks in two different positions. The results: 2 locks that are now useless. After one trip. I should have used zip strips. They would have done the same job for much cheaper. UPDATE: with a screwdriver I was able to reset the TSA lock. I am giving one star back because I was able to restore functionality. I am not giving more because this is an obvious design flaw and something the descriptions specifically says should not happen.
customer_reviews.author: V. L.

customer_reviews.title: Problem setting combo
customer_reviews.text: I set the combo with no problem on one lock. The second lock followed the same steps but the setting didn't work. I have not idea what the combination is now and I have a useless lock. Followed up with seller and got no satisfacttion. Not sure if it was a defective lock or what but one of my locks is just a paperweight now. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Tim_M

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after one use!
customer_reviews.text: Used one once on a single leg of a short flight from LAX to TUS. Got the bag back ok, but the lock was scratched and the material is so soft that the rotating dials were damaged. I could not turn the first and second dial until I used a pair of long-nosed pliers to do it. It is unusable now. Terrible quality, I wish I had kept the packaging so I could return them!
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: We used these on our recent vacation for a flight and cruise. They worked fabulously. Easy to open and close. Very reliable! Other locks have given me problem with locking or unlocking when needed! No such problem with these. The locks are really sturdy and well made. The larger loop makes them easier to handle and allowed us also use them to secure our bags to the lounge chairs at the beach. They're very easy to read and I foresee using them for much more than just vacation travel.
customer_reviews.author: regazzapaesa

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, so far.
customer_reviews.text: Have only used these locks on one trip, so can’t attest to their long term durability. But, worked fine for the one trip. I do like the flexible loop feature. My luggage zipper lock holes don’t line up anymore and/or have been smashed by baggage handling, so I have to get creative to be able to lock my luggage. The flexible loops help with that situation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pastore

customer_reviews.title: Saddle bag locks
customer_reviews.text: I use these to look my saddle bags closed on my motorcycle. They work great for this. Easy to cut off when you forget your combination. You get to set the combo for each lock. They are not going to keep anyone out that wants to steal anything from you. Keeps kids out of you stuff and keeps the saddle bags closed going down the highway. Keeps honest people honest.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great features, great flexibility.
customer_reviews.text: We bought eight of these and set them all to the same combination (very easy to do!) so they're interchangeable --whichever one we grab, we know what its combination is. Great for suitcases, of course, but also works great as a lock for gun cases for transporting firearms from home to range, or home to cabin, or whatever. without having to keep track of different keys for different locks if you have multiple transport cases. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: G. Rule

customer_reviews.title: Can be reset by a random stranger!
customer_reviews.text: Note - this is a great lock for keeping your backpack locked while you are traveling - like to keep other hands out of it, or thwart a metro type snag attack on whatever is in it. However, there is a simple switch on the back that (even when locked) unlocks the lock and you can change the code. This will not work for anything that you're going to leave locked and out of your sight. They worked well for what I needed, which was an extra lock for carry on luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great little lock for my luggage when traveling. The pop up feature is neat. My bag was checked by TSA and the little red thing popped. I checked my luggage and there was a note in there saying TSA checked it randomly. Awesome little feature and its a nice piece of mind letting you know if your bag has been checked just in case there wasn’t a note left behind by TSA. The only thing that I don’t like is, to lock it up have to press the lock/unlock with the right code to lock it, bring the strap, push it in, release button, then scramble the passcode to secure it.
customer_reviews.author: SashimiTaco

customer_reviews.title: Worked Wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: These worked well and fit though the zipper pull and the luggage lock hole on our bags. The are also small so I used them on my back pack when out sightseeing to prevent pick pockets. My only complaint is that the thin wire got bent up during airport travel on the first trip we took. I imagine they will not last too long but considering they need to be small to fit through the zipper pulls on our luggage that doesn’t have lock holes, I think that would have happened with any similar product. They worked great for us.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel locks
customer_reviews.text: Perfect locks. easy to use and it the TSA indicator does work well I just returned from trip to Vegas and sure enough when I got to Vegas the lock had been opened by TSA because the indicator popped up. Is nice to know when TSA decides to open your luggage without your knowledge. Very easy to set combination as well.
customer_reviews.author: Milford Harris

customer_reviews.title: potential problem
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the locks yet. But they seem to do the job I expect from them. I like the cable rather than the hard metal loop; easier to insert where needed. One potential problem is multiple combinations if the locks are shared. It would help if each lock was numbered so that a separate combination can be assigned to separate numbers. I did have problems with the first lock I tried. After setting it, it did not reopen. But I emailed the company and a new lock is on the way. Another possible help they could give- a place to write down the combinations used because some people (and we know who we are) tend to forget things.
customer_reviews.author: Boundary Waters Bill

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well. We did a two week cruise and side trips in six different hotels and airlines. On our last flight, the only bag that didn't have a lock got the snorkel mask stolen out of it. They were easy to set up and use. The only change I would make, is for the knob on the side that unlocks to be a little narrower. The bag that didn't have a lock needed a narrower end.
customer_reviews.author: HeartSmith

customer_reviews.title: Goldi-locks!
customer_reviews.text: These were just what we needed on our trip to FL last month. Luckily TSA never opened our luggage, but these have the neat feature that tells you if they did. Easy to set your own combo and use on your luggage. Yes, if there was a TSA guy that was lazy and used bolt cutters, they will get through these locks. But they have the TSA-compliant indicator as well as a spot they can use their 'super key' to unlock them easily. Like most other reviews, these get a thumbs up in my book.
customer_reviews.author: The Bas

customer_reviews.title: Default combination was set to 297?! Takes <10 minutes to brute force.
customer_reviews.text: I unpackaged the lock and set the combination to 000 as instructed. The lock did not open. I could not change the combination without opening it first. So, I decided to brute force it. About 3 minutes later I entered 297 and the lock opened.. Very bizarre. I was able to change the combination once opened. This made me realize how easily the lock is to brute force. You can test all 999 combinations in less than 10 minutes.. so the average time to open is 5 minutes. I suggest going for a 4 digit lock.
customer_reviews.author: Drummer52895

customer_reviews.title: Love the Pros!
customer_reviews.text: I overall love these. Pros: Love the vibrant colors so I can find them easier, the dials move easy to get the locks undone, they have longer locks to fit multiple zippers. Cons: The lock portion is flexible, which I thought would be an easier to manipulate, but it makes the lock much harder to lock back up. Make sure to use a shirt or towel to give yourself a better grip. But overall, this lock is nice enough that I dont worry too much about the difficulty in locking portion.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Love the "hooks"
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what you call it but it's the thing that you have to put between the zippers to lock them together. Whatever it's called (I'll call it a hook), I bought this lock because the hook isn't metal. It's flexible and therefore easy to get through the zippers to lock them. And it's longer than previous locks I've purchased. This is just like the name brand locks but at a fraction of the price. I am very happy with this purchase and will buy more like this when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Airplanes and cruises
customer_reviews.text: Love the simplicity of using these little locks for our luggage. Don't want anyone except TSA looking in our luggage and these do the trick. Simple and easy to set and reset as needed. Has a little indicator that pops up to show TSA has opened your bag. These day the list is getting longer for what you can and can not carry in your bags. I appreciate TSA checking and making sure we are all safe. And I feel safer knowing that only they can open my bags.
customer_reviews.author: Walker, Reviewer and Artist

customer_reviews.title: Works for a gun case!
customer_reviews.text: I’d imagine this would do much better for what it’s intended to do, which is be a lock for luggage and not a gun case, but I love this little thing. I do wish, however, that the cord was just an inch or two longer; it calls for some awkward hand/finger acrobatics to lock my gun case, but becomes second nature after repeatedly doing it. Be sure you use a small pen/pin to latch and unlatch the combination setting lock instead of your finger or nail!
customer_reviews.author: eilleilleT

customer_reviews.title: Easy set lock and great value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use with my savior gun case and they are perfect for my application. Setting the lock was easy and I feel good about their performance. Haven’t used them for traveling so I cannot speak on the TSA feature, but I didn’t buy them for that, so it’s not a concern for me needs. Highly recommended and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use as long as you have the proper luggage.
customer_reviews.text: TSA was happy with these. They left us nice notes to the effect they searched our bags. LOL! Check the zipper handles of your bags and see that they have some capability of being secured shut with, basically, a wire. If so, you're good to go. The "wire" on these locks is perhaps a 1/16th inch or less, and about 1 inch long in the locked position. Locks themselves were easy to reprogram and use. Would recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Roadshopper

customer_reviews.title: Cable lock more secure than metal U lock of this size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set for travel outside of US airspace (the Western World). The locks were easy to use, opened and locked reliably, and survived the ordeal quite well. The advantage of the flexible cable is that it isn't easy to pop open or "spring" like a traditional lock of this size does. While it will not dissuade a determined thief from cutting the cable and breaking into the luggage, it will deter a thief who uses a screwdriver or similar tool to pop the lock open.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Practical

customer_reviews.title: Code issue
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed... i’ve bought a set last year and i was very satisfied. When i opened the package, i’ve noticed these locks weren’t exactly the same. I follow the instructions to set up the new combination and i’ve notice that you can not close if your code is not done. So, You have to open And close yourself because you’ve to use your code. If you use a lock and you forget to lock and ask to someone else to do it. This person will have your code... My previous ones close even if it’s not the good code.
customer_reviews.author: Heiata

customer_reviews.title: Travelers, just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Ya girl is not just frugal... I'm straight up cheap. There are things in life I don't believe in the investment... this isn't one of those things. You can buy a cheaper version of this, but tell me... if someone does break into your stuff and steals from you, will it be worth the >$5 price difference? I don't lock up anything that I don't think is valuable so to me I want the best product. This is the best product, bar none.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Great lock but, not for handgun cases
customer_reviews.text: Great little lock but, not acceptable for hand gun cases. TSA doesn’t allow the use of locks that still allow the case to open enough to insert a hand which this one does, easily. The cable on this is too long for my case (which I bought here as well) and to short to double wrap it. I had to buy 2 locks (one for each corner) from the airline. I’m so grateful they had some available to purchase. The lock itself, is nice, though.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this lock is safe to use on ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this lock is safe to use on the luggage. The code can be change in the locked positon. All you have to do is flip the switch in the back and change to a new combination. So your luggage can be open by anyone who is familiar with this product. Plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described, work like a charm, easy to use and love the TSA search alert on them as TSA has opened my bags before and i've had stuff stolen. Now i know when they go in! The narrow chain part also hooks on even the smallest zipper so fits on backpacks and odd zippers too! The bright orange color also helps me identify my bags quickly. Don't everyone buy this color though, or mine won't stand out. :)
customer_reviews.author: mcoffeesnob

customer_reviews.title: It’s got a big end tight to slip it in.
customer_reviews.text: The cord and the clip in the end are too large to place through a regular zipper. Have one case that had dedicated holes for a lock it’s works great. I tried it on the other and it is a tight squeeze to get it through the zips but I couldn’t get it out. Had to cut it off. I have regular locks that I can use here no problem but I thought these more flexible one would be better. Glad I tried it before I traveled and would be locked out of my luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Zackary Hunt

customer_reviews.title: These Locks are Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these locks, as I like to travel. Just this year I’ve been to the Hawaiian Islands, Tacoma Washington and I’m heading to Texas in August. I’ve never felt comfortable not having a lock on my suitcase. I used one of these locks for my trip to Tacoma. I didn’t have any problem at the airports, and an added bonus, I had peace of mind when turning my bag over to the agent. I really like these locks! I bought a set of 6 so I could share them with my friends who like to travel.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie13

customer_reviews.title: Great locks - ordered more
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these last year and they have held up great. I needed another lock a couple of weeks ago and bought a similar one at the local big named retail store. It was a waste of money: more expensive and not near the quality. These locks are easy to set, numbers line up very easily to reopen, numbers are clearly printed, over all much better quality. I only needed one to replace the lock I purchased at the local retail store. I chose to buy the four pack for future needs just in case I need more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy O.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Travel Lock
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lock. It is about 100 times better quality than a similar lock I bought at the airport years ago. I lost that one recently and was looking to replace it and was amazed by the quality of this lock. Glad I found it and got the resulting upgrade over my old lock. This new lock closes and opens easily. It’s easy to see and set the combination setting. It also seems very sturdy. I also like that it has the alert button that shows that TSA has unlocked it. I haven’t seen it activated yet but I’m assuming it will work as promised due to the overall quality of the lock.
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The lock was easy to set to its combination and easy to use but, as others have said, the inspection button did not work. When I was unpacking I found the TSA inspection notice in the bag while the lock did not indicate it was opened. This wasn't any big deal to me but if it is to you then be aware it may not work. One good thing is it obviously worked for them to open and relock it because the lock was not cut.
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: Worst product...
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. I bought these at the last minute for my 2 back to back cruises around Australia and New Zealand. They didn't work easily and they were hard to open and close. I finally have up and didn't use them at all which was upsetting for me because I really wanted protection of expensive clothes and jewelry I was bringing. Don't purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: SouthFloridaGirl

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my trip to South Africa. These were perfection. They are super easy to set the passcode. They are a great deterrent for someone trying to get into your bag, especially when you are overseas. The product is very sturdy. They work great too if you have a Suitcase cover for your luggage; this way no one can even see that your luggage is locked.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality lock
customer_reviews.text: I have had these locks before for family vacations. They are easy to use, set up your own combo, and seem like a very good quality. I like the flexible loop to lock zipper pulls that don't quite meet, like on backpacks, etc. I'm hoping the bright green will be both easy to identify at luggage carousels and for potential pick-pockets, so they don't even bother to attempt it!
customer_reviews.author: KY fan

customer_reviews.title: Lock wont open !!! Company offered to mail new one 👌👌
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: contacted seller and described issue. They responded quickly and offered to send new lock, said I may have a defective unit. Awesome ! Bought these locks 2 months ago and just opened them today as we are traveling international tomorrow. Followed the east instructions on the back of packaging to reset the lock code. Used same lock code for both locks. 1st lock changed just fine. Followed same steps for 2nd lock and it wont open. Greeeeaattt....what a waste 🙄🙄😑😑
customer_reviews.author: Crystal S

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set!
customer_reviews.text: These locks are super easy to set with your personal code and work great! The numbers are also east on the eyes and the button to unlock is very convenient. Not like others. I purchased these based on the fact the were “Amazon Choice” and I’m so glad that I did. The previous locks that I bought from a different company were difficult to set and the ones before those were ruined by TSA.
customer_reviews.author: Karmel DST

customer_reviews.title: A traveler must have
customer_reviews.text: We never used locks on our luggage until now. While we are seasoned travelers & know not to leave anything valuable in our suitcase, we found additional piece of mind with this handy lock, especially when leaving a case at hotels when our room wasn't ready. It was also great to keep important items locked in the hotel room, when we were gone all day. Easy to use, secure & a good price point. It is a good buy, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maurlee

customer_reviews.title: these locks are the best for securing briefcases and luggage.
customer_reviews.text: the flexible cable makes securing briefcases and other luggage accessories that do not have an integrated lock assembly as part of their zipper an easy task. The combination numbers are large and easy to read and the locks are TSA compliant. You can easily set your own custom combination.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Monahan

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We bought new luggage for an up coming trip and needed new locks as well. After searching thru all the various locks on the market I decided to order these. I am very pleased with how easy they were to set up the combinations and they function easily. I would suggest them to everyone. Since they have a lifetime warranty I won't have to purchase for myself again.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: SUPER GREAT !  easy to use, safe and very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal, make sure you buy them here before you head for the airport and have to pay 4 times as much for less quality. You can set your own combination so easy and they are so easy to attach to zippers and everything. Strong cable but flexible to thread. I defiantly would re-order again. Maybe even order an extra set to give to friends traveling or sell to admiring other travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Brother Bragg

customer_reviews.title: Thin but strong wire clasp
customer_reviews.text: Instead of a forged metal clasp, it uses a metal cable, which seems pretty strong. It might not deter a thief with a good pair of wirecutters, but I suspect a wiser thief would just cut through the fabric of a soft case with a pair of scissors. These things are just to deter the un-tooled thief, I think. I use it on a small cloth briefcase and if nothing else, it gives me a sense of security. It's well made, easy to open and close, with an adjustable combination.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: Secured
customer_reviews.text: I was rather surprised by these locks. Right out of the package they have a good solid feel and quality. The cable is much better than the stiff u-bar lock mechanism and very snug in the receiver. Solid die cast body and the code setting pin very secure, recessed, and not at all likely to be manipulated during handling. I anticipate using these not only on our luggage abroad but also on personal packs and gym bags in daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Dhampire

customer_reviews.title: nothing special
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing special about this lock.....other than it's color! TSA seemed to lose every lock that's black, so I thought I'd try and help them out by using these, and it seems to be working. Only lost 1 in about a dozen flights since I've switched. Also they help you find your bag if it's black like the rest of the world.
customer_reviews.author: B. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great Lock
customer_reviews.text: I find this locks very easy to use. Easy to set your code, one very important thing is do not forget the code you set. There is no reset code (which keeps the security of the lock), if you forget it, might as well throw it away. I like it where you just insert the cable and not have to slide it to lock, and slide to unlock.
customer_reviews.author: Tomcat

customer_reviews.title: We can finally keep medication and diabetic candy safe.
customer_reviews.text: Mom has type one diabetes and my brother is an adult with autism. She needs to keep candy handy for when she has low blood sugar, but he always gets into it. He is in a day program and they now require his expired Epi-Pen to be in a locked bag, so hopefully we do not need either, but if he needs the Epi-Pen, or she needs the candy, we should be safe.
customer_reviews.author: J. H. McNeil

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set your own combo and work well
customer_reviews.text: These are great and were easy to set my own combination. Down to 1 since one on my luggage went missing after my fight home. I got these since they're TSA approved so either they cut it off and didn't care that they had a master key for it or they just chose not to place it back on. Either way, I will be purchasing more for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought locks for a cruise I’m going on in April. I based my purchased on a few points. TSA approved, not a traditional padlock as far as it has a flex cable to connect lock and zippers. Read reviews. I liked the fact TSA could search luggage if they felt necessary. Then locking it back up and giving me please if mind no one else can open. I don’t bring valuables on a trip but to me my clothing, shoes and right down to my undergarments no one else business. I gave 4 stars due to not having used it yet
customer_reviews.author: joanne

customer_reviews.title: TSA detecting
customer_reviews.text: These locks are great! Easy to use. Nice looking. Best of all if TSA opens your lock a red light comes on so you know your bag has been opened. I had a slight issue with one lock. Contacted SureLock. They tried to help but the lock was defective or damaged. Contacted Amazon and got a replacement order. All locks are good. You want a travel lock? This is the one to get!!
customer_reviews.author: Ice Queen

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, Good Price, Sturdy and Easy to Setup
customer_reviews.text: Made me feel very secure while traveling out of the country. It was super easy to set up and very sturdy. I love the TSA feature that lets you know whether it's been opened. And I truly believe it's a deterrent for dubious individuals. FYI I also use when I'm in the hotel so it's a multipurpose purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Great locks but there's 1 problem.
customer_reviews.text: Locks were amazing. We really liked the variety of color of them and the durability of them. However, TSA did inspect one of our bags and the little red indicator was NOT popped up. Not a huge deal but if the feature is there, I want it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Like a few others on here I purchased a 4 pack and three of my locks worked great!! Good quality (feel heavy and sturdy), easy to change the combo, easy to lock and unlock...but when I went to change my fourth locks combo something happened (manufacturing error I believe) and the lock wouldn't unlock no matter what I tried. So I contacted the company and was able to get a different lock to replace my malfunctioning one in a matter of days!! They even changed the combo for me! :) Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. It works great and I had no issues with setting or resetting my combinations. The only possible problem area might be that you will need a tool to help you move the switch to set your code. I used a pair of keys because I could not push the switch over with my fingers or with my nails.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read
customer_reviews.text: Have other TSA locks and the numbers are difficult to read. It may also be that I am getting older and the eyesight is not what it used to be. These locks are very easy to read even in low light. Also, like the flexible cable rather than a fixed shank. It is easier to lock our various luggage pieces. The push button release is another nice feature not found on other locks.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Did it's job.
customer_reviews.text: TSA apparently had a reason to open my checked bags. Lock worked like I would have expected. The little red button was up when I picked up my bags. Inside was the TSA flyer letting me know they were there. They bend\t the cable a little, but a pair of pliers fixed the problem. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JohnZ

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I used this when I went to Europe to lock my backpack as it had my laptop and several hundred dollars worth of calculators. It's super easy to chose your combo and there's no sticking or issues locking and unlocking it. One issue I had was my dad managed to unlock it without knowing the combination after fiddling with it for a couple minutes?? All he said was "I know the secrets" -- do with this information what you will. Don't leave your luggage unattended I guess lol
customer_reviews.author: Maria S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, very sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These are great and very easy to set your own combination, very easy to use. They're also very sturdy and well-made. The four-pack is a great value and gives me enough for each piece of my luggage so I don't have to hunt around for a lock when I travel, trying to remember where I left it, now I leave one on each bag.
customer_reviews.author: TrishaM

customer_reviews.title: Anyone can open it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the silliest lock I have ever seen. You can change the combination while the lock is locked and then open it with the new combination. How in the world does that provide any security?
customer_reviews.author: usmutti

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap lock set
customer_reviews.text: These are great for their price cost. After 2 rounds of my bags being checked with these locks attached the locks have deteriorated. Granted most locks do but the coating around the wire has deteriorated and it looks like they only have a few more trips in them. Granted this is somewhat expected given the cost.
customer_reviews.author: bart cortright

customer_reviews.title: Nice Locks
customer_reviews.text: We used these on a trip to Ireland/Scotland recently. Easy to lock/unlock. Easy to set you own combo. I was nice having the peace of mind that someone random person could not get into my luggage. Obviously anyone with the TSA key could get into bag but it takes more effort.
customer_reviews.author: Don Baker

customer_reviews.title: Deters theft at the airport but that's it
customer_reviews.text: I use this lock for my ski bag and it works well. The TSA feature is nice so that they have to lock it back up after opening. Other than that, it's basic and I do not recommend to use anywhere other than airport travel. I can pick this lock manually in seconds or under a second with a rake.
customer_reviews.author: Tom A.

customer_reviews.title: Great locks - Customer Servce lacking
customer_reviews.text: Love the locks but 9ne is broken. I have contacted the company twice with no reply, no response. They've left me no choice but to send all of them back. Too bad - loved them except the broken one. The company needs to step up their customer service and respond. I'd give the product a 5 star but lack of customer service, can't do it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well-made; TSA notification nice feature
customer_reviews.text: Simple lock that does what it's supposed to do. One nice feature that my previous TSA locks don't have is the notification when TSA has opened your luggage. A red protrusion sticks out, instantly telling you they've opened the suitcase. Quality looks to be good, solidly built. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Stu Howard

customer_reviews.title: They Work Well In All Respects
customer_reviews.text: Working very well for several reasons: Easy to set a code. Easy to lock. Easy to un-lock. The "cable" hasp fits many more places than a rigid hasp. They are light weight, so they're un-noticed when carrying luggage, backpacks, golf clubs, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ChipCdM

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful Lock
customer_reviews.text: I used this lock to fasten the zipper of my hiking backpack when I took an international flight. It gave me a peace of mind knowing that when I stowed the bag and dozed off to sleep, the contents are protected. I'd recommend it to anyone who's looking for a simple TSA-approved lock.
customer_reviews.author: KSor

customer_reviews.title: Travel Essential
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the long lock as it's easy to get through luggage pull zippers. Didn't lose during TSA inspection. Very versatile for backpacks. While isn't going to keep someone with a clippers away, it does its job through airport transport on international flights and hotel stays.
customer_reviews.author: Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Great TSA approved lock
customer_reviews.text: This lock worked very well with my luggage. The code was very easy to set for a first timer. My bag had been "inspected" when going thru the airport security, and of course the lock was fine. I love the flexible feature on the cord and makes ease of use effortless.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: No réponse to email for assistance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 locks. They have some great features especially the highly visible combination. However, I ran into a problem setting up the 2nd lock. I follloed direction as I did for the first lock and was successful However, I couldn't open the 2nd lock after installing the same como as the first. Two emails to vendor and stilll no response on remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 1 use
customer_reviews.text: I set the code and was able to lock/unlock it multiple times throughout the day. The next time I went to lock the lock, it would not close and my code did not work. I did some research and TSA could have broken it if they opened it but it is a TSA compatible lock. These are cheap so at least they are not pricey to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has the best TSA lock option
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for me and my family. Didn’t work that good on my Pelican case, leaves a gap for opening/stealing. Worked good on other suitcases. One received damaged to the side metal part along the numbers, causing it to cease up. The rubber cover for the metal Lanyard is starting to Fray(was expected). The best thing about this lock is the indicator pin that pops up if TSA opens it. I wish every lock had that option! But it’s only good if you use a luggage like a hard case. Note: Sippers are easy for baggage handlers to get around.
customer_reviews.author: joseph manzano

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: The lock worked very well. I never used it when flying as I understand that frequently the TSA inspectors don't use their key and just cut them off. I did use it quite a bit at the hotel , on the bus, train and general storage. I was easy to set and use.
customer_reviews.author: Marf

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: The locks are easy to operate, easy to change the default combination and seem very durable. As for the seller, they ROCK! One of the locks in the eight pack didn't operate properly, they actually contacted me to make sure everything was ok with the order. When I responded back about the one lock, they immediately took action to replace the defective lock. Within 4 hours of letting them know about the defective lock I received a tracking number for the replacement. I would recommend this seller with 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tutti

customer_reviews.title: Had lots of inspections and each lock worked as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly while being inspected around the world. Used all 4 as I traveled around the world, and was screened far more than any other trip. I had both my hand luggage inspected as well as my checked bags checked both inbound and outbound. Each lock displayed the appropriate inspection indicator, relocked reliably, and reset the indicator.
customer_reviews.author: Spardan

customer_reviews.title: One of the locks failed to open while travelling with ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the locks failed to open while travelling with my rifle for a hunt. I had to get a border patrol agent in Canada to cut the lock for me so I could use my rifle on the hunt. I then had to buy a lock to replace it in canada so that I could travel back home. Do not buy these locks. I do not even have the option to return the product and it has been less than 60 days since purchasing. I guess it is my fault that I planned ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lax

customer_reviews.title: Could not get new combination to work ...
customer_reviews.text: ... following the instructions for this piece of junk. After resetting the combination from 000 to a new one, the first one I tried it on would not open for either the new combination OR 000. Unless you can afford to be delayed by having locks cut off your luggage, DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson's Regulator

customer_reviews.title: Overall, fine.
customer_reviews.text: The locks worked fine, The combination was set and didn't get changed in baggage handling. They were easy to open and close. The only flaw was that one of the numbers has half peeled off. It happened the second time I tried them out. Fortunately, it was only one number and I can easily figure out where it is. Of course it happened to be one of the numbers in my combination.
customer_reviews.author: Euridice

customer_reviews.title: Work great, nice design
customer_reviews.text: These have a very design, flexibility of a cable rather than hard metal on the latch. I like the easy combination code and its well made. Overall I'm very happy with these locks and have used them in my travels on a variety of luggage types.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Solid product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the weight of these locks; they replace some plastic versions I bought some years ago and appear very well made. I like the cable shackle as it allows me to lock both the strap and the compartments of my anti-theft backpack with a single lock. Best of all was the customer service. I had an issue with one of the locks that I caused myself. I emailed the company and was immediately sent a replacement even after I told them it was my fault. That's really great in my book. I would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Miller III

customer_reviews.title: I love easy read dials & combination settings
customer_reviews.text: I love these locks, because the numbers are white on black background. It is easy to read for my eyes. I bought 4 locks, and use them for my gym lockers, too. And I also love the easy combination setting. To me, this is the best travel lock. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking trips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4-pack to share with my friend on our backpacking trip through Europe this past summer. We each used 2 on our bags and were extremely happy with them. At one point my friend was using one on her smaller wallet as well which kept her happy knowing her money and important travel documents were safe. We never had any issues with the locks. I loved their flexibility and thin loop that fit in every zipper. These also became useful when we stayed at hostels and needed to lock our storage bins. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Gentry

customer_reviews.title: buy with confidence great quality.
customer_reviews.text: these locks came exactly as advertised and worked great to block our very expensive hockey bags and luggage when traveling by air to a hockey camp halfway across the country. They stayed locked in the code was very easy to set for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: BryanB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome durable travel locks
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything bad about these. They feel very durable and easy to use. The locks have a wire cable which was thin enough to be able to go through the zippers on both backpacks. While in use, it was still easy to turn the dials and enter the combination. I would definitely by more in the future and recommend these locks to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Abram Cash

customer_reviews.title: Good Lock - TSA approved
customer_reviews.text: I already had a similar lock for my suitcase, but wanted one for my wife. Really did no know that you could use locks that only TSA could open ( I had some stuff lifted in s flight last year) . This is a godsend - easy to use and set to a custom combination.
customer_reviews.author: Fritz Coombs

customer_reviews.title: What a great lock!
customer_reviews.text: I like this lock. It locks, and then you put in your 3-digit code and it unlocks! You can change the code as often as you'd like, but don't try to use your fingernails when resetting the code or you'll break them up. I use this to lock a messenger bag. Only my wife can get into it because she guessed my code. Or someone with bolt cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Just get it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these locks for a two-week trip to Europe. The bright colors made them easy to check and were a clear deterrent for theft. We loved that we could set the codes ourself and see if bags had been searched prior to opening.
customer_reviews.author: hdod

customer_reviews.title: A great go to travel lock
customer_reviews.text: I did actually find the numbers easier to read on this one. I thought the button release was a bit gimmicky, but I do no appreciate it. I wish it were slightly easier to push the connected back into the lock when you are locking something, but it is a minor issue. Recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wegner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set and use. Seems to last long.
customer_reviews.text: Do not expect this to be close to indestructible. People can just break the zipper and steal you stuff if they want to. This looks durable and will stand the abuse of luggage handling and having the flexible cable to loop around the sliders means this lock will not cause damage to sliders itself.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Exposed combination
customer_reviews.text: Nice lock that arrived today. Only issue is your combination is exposed when the lock is unlocked. It's required that the lock will display the set combination as long as it's unlocked. You must lock it before you can rotate the number from your secret code.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Fenton

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had a issue with American Airlines, with my suite case being opened and items missing. This time I used the lock and although TSA opened my suite case the little red button was up on the lock so I knew they opened my suite case and there was a TSA paper inside. Problem solved
customer_reviews.author: Janice Martucci

customer_reviews.title: Significantly Better Than Other Locks I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: Easier to see numbers in dim light. Dials stay where you move them without slipping, so easier to unlock. Inspection detector is useful. Can be used with *separate* cables that have looped ends, to lock several bags cabled together or around furniture in hotel rooms, making items harder to carry off. Might be nice to see this style of lock have a thicker cable to deter thieves with cutters.
customer_reviews.author: KManReviews

product_meta.title: TSA Compatible Travel Luggage Locks, Inspection Indicator, Easy Read Dials TSA Approved Padlock with Zinc Alloy
feature_bullets: THE MOST DURABLE LOCK ON THE MARKET. SureLock uses an ultra tough alloy body to protect our locks from the harshest of baggage handling. Our hardened stainless steel internal lock mechanisms won't rust or freeze up even after years of use. Put our locks to the test. We back them with a complete money back guarantee.

PEACE OF MIND WITH AN INSPECTION INDICATOR. Know if your luggage has been inspected as soon as you pick it up at the airport with our pop-up inspection indicator. If the TSA has opened your luggage, a button will pop out of the top of the cable lock. You'll know to double check your luggage to make sure nothing has gone missing while you're still at the airport instead of at your hotel or final destination.

FOOLPROOF COMBINATION SETTING MECHANISM. Easily set your own combination with a simple flick of a switch. With the factory default combination of 000 entered, use a pen to flick the switch to the right. Enter your new combination and flick the switch back to the left. Setting your combination is that easy.

A SECURE LOCK WHICH WORKS WITH NEARLY ANY KIND OF LUGGAGE. Cable locks can secure luggage which steel shackle locks can not. Pelican cases, gun cases, equipment cases, etc. can all be locked easily and safely with our flexible cable. At an ideal lenght of 4 inches from end to end and a closed lenght of 1.5 inches, SureLock's cable is the ideal size for your travel security needs.

EASY TO READ DIALS. SureLock uses a white numeral on a black background for our combination dials. These high contrast dials make reading your combination a breeze. No more squinting or searching for glasses as you try to open your locks.
